Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Imam Shamsi Ali, Islamic Cultural Center of New York City 1711 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10128.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Mark-Viverito.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Imam Shamsi  Ali, Islamic Cultural Center of New York City, 1711 Third Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10128.

Council Member Mark-Viverito moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution authorizing the Council to file an amicus brief in the New York Court of Appeals in support of the Plaintiffs-Appellees in the litigation captioned Casado v. Markus, for the purpose of supporting the Plaintiffs-Appellees’ petition to annul and vacate certain provisions of 2008 Apartment and Loft Law # 40 and 2009 Apartment and Loft Law # 41.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote. 

Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 4 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Ignizio, Koo, Ulrich and Oddo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the Plaintiffs-Appellees’ petition to annul and vacate certain provisions of 2008 Apartment and Loft Law # 40 and 2009 Apartment and Loft Law # 41.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to increase the civil penalties to $2,500 for a first offense and $15,000 for each subsequent offense within a two year period for failure to comply with the utility notification requirements of Article 36 of the General Business Law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Increase the civil penalties to $2,500 for a first offense and $15,000 for each subsequent offense within a two year period for failure to comply with the utility notification requirements of Article 36 of the General Business Law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Housing Finance Agency to halt implementation of its proposed guidance regarding “flip taxes” or at the very least exempt New York City cooperatives and condominiums due to the detrimental effect of such proposed guidance on New York City cooperatives and condominiums.
